definition: to revere/to admire
to gaze/to view
surname Yang
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on

sentences.english: It attracted many thousands of visitors from all levels of society.
sentences.chinese: 水晶宮曾吸收了社會各階級的瞻仰者駐足欣賞。

sentences.english: This is perhaps the most viewed penis in all of history.
sentences.chinese: 這估計是有史以來被最多人瞻仰的雞雞了。

sentences.english: We paid a visit to the monument to the revolutionary martyrs with great respect.
sentences.chinese: 我們懷着崇敬的心情瞻仰了革命烈士紀念碑。

sentences.english: Pay respects to Concentration Camp piously.
Canterbury I make a point of visiting the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 每次我在坎特伯雷時，總要去瞻仰一下大教堂。

sentences.english: Russia lauds China's role in G20.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯瞻仰中國在20國集團中的作用。

sentences.english: The first plgenius that they visited in London wlike Big Ben.
sentences.chinese: 在倫敦新妓生傳們瞻仰關雲長第一個場所是大本鐘。

sentences.english: Obaloneyerv is the best tefeel sorer.
Head next door to the Novodevichy Cemetery and visit the graves of some of Russia's greatest luminaries.
sentences.chinese: 走近新聖女公墓可以瞻仰到很多俄國偉人。

sentences.english: In my opinion, we should go to see the Sun Zhongshan Mausoleum.
sentences.chinese: 依我看，我們應該去瞻仰中山陵。

sentences.english: The students came from a long way off to show their respect for the revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 學生們經過長途跋涉來瞻仰革命先烈。

sentences.english: A love of sport may possibly requisite for a princess.
sentences.chinese: 對活動的瞻仰大略是一位王妃所必需的。

sentences.english: United in love and one in spirit, Be holding Thy gracious face.
sentences.chinese: 靈裏相交，愛中相連，瞻仰恩主榮面。

sentences.english: In the red mausoleum, Lenin people visit every day the dead looks.
sentences.chinese: 在紅場裏的列寧陵墓，每天都有民衆瞻仰其遺容。

sentences.english: Whenever I'm in Canterbury I make a point of visiting the cathedral .
sentences.chinese: 每次我在坎特伯雷時，總要去瞻仰一下大教堂。

definition: to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to pay homage (at a monument, mausoleum etc)
appearance/view/abiding impression
to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
to kneel and bow with joined hands at forehead level/to worship
to admire/to revere/to look up to
to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
to worship/to gaze with reverence
body of the deceased (esp. in the context of paying one's respects)/picture of the deceased
to offer sacrifice (to one's ancestors)
to formally call on/to worship (a God)/to pay homage to sb
to prostrate oneself in worship (idiom)/(fig.) to worship/to bow down to
to view/to look at/to look sth over
to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
(molded or modeled) statue
to visit/to pay one's respects to (a revered figure etc)/to pay homage (at a tomb etc)
